definition: to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: Your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High;
sentences.chinese: 你们的赏赐就必大了，你们也必作至高者的儿子。

sentences.english: Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.
sentences.chinese: 所以你们不可丢弃勇敢的心，存这样的心必得大赏赐。
既是这样，我的赏赐是什么呢。

sentences.english: He who receives … shall receive reward.
God would not waste the mind he gave you! God does not want robots to serve him.
sentences.chinese: 神不会浪费他赏赐你的心智，他不要机械人来事奉他。

sentences.english: Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
sentences.chinese: 我实在告诉你们，他们已经得了他们的赏赐。

sentences.english: Humility and the fear of the Lord bring wealth and honor and life.
sentences.chinese: 敬畏耶和华心存谦卑，就得富有，尊荣，生命为赏赐。

sentences.english: Two peaches were to be awarded to the two of them who deserved it the most.
sentences.chinese: 两只桃子将被赏赐给其中功劳最大的两个人。

sentences.english: Therefore the LORD hath recompensed me according to my righteousness; according to my cleanness in his eye sight.
sentences.chinese: 所以耶和华按我的公义，按我在他眼前的清洁赏赐我。

sentences.english: Cor. 9:18 What then is my reward?
sentences.chinese: 林前九18这样，我的赏赐是什么？

sentences.english: Even better, God has promised to reward your faithfulness in eternity.
sentences.chinese: 更美好的是，神应允要在永恒的国度里赏赐你的忠心。

sentences.english: The bounteous largess given thee to give?
sentences.chinese: 慷慨的赏赐，却不予转交？

sentences.english: I am giving you the service of the priesthood as a gift.
sentences.chinese: 我将祭司的职任给你们当作赏赐事奉我。

sentences.english: The gift of life, the original only reward for those willing to try on a person.
sentences.chinese: 生命的厚礼，原来只赏赐给那些肯于一尝的人。

sentences.english: Another is Pope grants for Cassie the Mole ancestor's statue.
sentences.chinese: 另一幅则是教皇赏赐给卡西莫尔先祖的塑像。

to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to bestow a prize or reward/an award
to offer tribute/to pay tribute that a vassal owes to his suzerain
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
special favor from a ruler/Emperor's generosity towards a favorite
